name: Celebrity Tomato
climate: Prefers warm climates with temperatures between 70°F to 85°F.
Can tolerate slightly cooler climates but growth may slow down.
Very sensitive to frost and cannot withstand freezing temperatures.
Requires a long growing season for optimal fruit production.
sunlight: Needs full sun with at least 6 to 8 hours of direct sunlight per day.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to leggy plants and fewer fruits.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade may be beneficial.
Positioning near a south-facing wall can help maximize sun exposure.
watering: Requires consistent watering to keep soil evenly moist but not waterlogged.
Deep watering is recommended to encourage strong root systems.
Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings to prevent rot.
Avoid overhead watering to reduce the risk of fungal diseases.
soil: Thrives in well-draining, fertile soil enriched with organic matter.
Slightly acidic to neutral soil pH between 6.0 and 7.0 is ideal.
Incorporate compost or well-rotted manure to enhance nutrient levels.
Soil should be loose to promote root growth and nutrient uptake.
extra_care_tip: Prune suckers and lower leaves to improve air circulation around plants.
Mulching around the base can help retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Stake or cage plants to support heavy fruit loads and avoid bending.
Regularly check for pests such as aphids and treat promptly.
